page.title: 05Codnor Park Reservoir
page.content: The reservoir at Codnor Park, built originally to top up the canal, has been altered because of the Parliament Safety Rules.The alterations to the reservoir altogether{cost 420,000 pounds.They have lowered the water to 5m at the deepest point and 1m in the shallow point.They have built two weirs to keep the water the right level if there is a big storm.There is a bridge across the two weirs.There is concrete lining at the bottom and sides of the weir to stop the banks from getting washed away.In the worst possible storm the water would rise a metre above the weirs and the water would be half a metre deep in the canal.There will be two picnic areas next to the weirs.In the picnic areas there will be benches,trees and grass which the council will provide.It will all be finished in{September 1985.
